services at Russell Square tube station on 7 July 2005 |location = Aboard
London Underground trains and a bus in central London |target = General public
|date = 7 July 2005 08:50 â 09:47 BST |timezone = |type =
Mass murder; suicide attack; terrorism |fatalities = 52 civilians + 4 bombers
|injuries = Approximately 700 |perps = Hasib Hussain Mohammad Sidique
Khan Germaine Lindsay Shehzad Tanweer }} The '7 July 2005 London
bombings' (often referred to as '7/7') were a series of co-ordinated suicide
attacks in London which targeted civilians using the public transport system
during the morning rush hour.

On the morning of Thursday, 7 July 2005, four Islamist home-grown terrorists
detonated four bombs, three in quick succession aboard London Underground trains
across the city and, later, a fourth on a double-decker bus in Tavistock Square.
Fifty-two civilians and the four bombers were killed in the attacks, and over
700 more were injured.

The explosions were caused by homemade organic peroxideâbased devices packed
into rucksacks. The bombings were followed exactly two weeks later by a series
of attempted attacks.
categories: Islamist terrorism in the United Kingdom
